name: PARID
title: Parcel Identification Number
description: A 16 character unique identifier for the parcel.

name: PROPERTYHOUSENUM
title: House Number
description: House Number for the  physical location of property; may be zero or blank.

name: PROPERTYFRACTION
title: House Number Fraction
description: Continued House Number information for the  physical location of property; such as 1/2, the house number ending range, or a letter.

name: PROPERTYADDRESS
title: Street
description: Street name for the  physical location of the property, including directional indicators and suffixes.

name: PROPERTYCITY
title: City
description: City where the property is physically located.

name: PROPERTYSTATE
title: State
description: State where the property is physically located.

name: PROPERTYUNIT
title: Unit Number
description: Unit numbers for the property, such as condo units (e.g. 1, 3C,  115A, B13, etc�.).

name: PROPERTYZIP
title: Zip code
description: Zip Code where the property is physically located.

name: MUNICODE
title: Municipality Code
description: Municipality number associated with specified parcel.

name: MUNIDESC
title: Municipality Name
description: Municipality name associated with specified parcel.

name: SCHOOLCODE
title: School District Code
description: School district number associated with specified parcel.

name: SCHOOLDESC
title: School District Name
description: School district name associated with specified parcel.

name: LEGAL1
title: Legal Description 1
description: Line 1 of parcel legal description from the Deed.

name: LEGAL2
title: Legal Description 2
description: Line 2 continuation of parcel legal description from the Deed.

name: LEGAL3
title: Legal Description 3
description: Line 3 continuation of parcel legal description from the Deed.

name: NEIGHCODE
title: Neighborhood Number
description: The ID number for the valuation neighborhood containing this parcel.   Valuation neighborhoods were delineated as part of the 2013 reassessment.  A valuation neighborhood is a geographic area exhibiting a high degree of homogeneity in economic amenities, land use, economic trends, and property characteristics such as quality, age, and condition.

name: NEIGHDESC
title: Neighborhood Name
description: The name associated with the valuation neighborhood number, if a name exists.

name: TAXCODE
title: Tax Status
description:
Tax Status indicates whether or not real estate taxes apply to a parcel's assessment.   Parcels may be Taxable (must pay local taxes), Exempt (pay no taxes), or PURTA [Public Utility Realty Tax Act (if taxes are paid, they are paid into a state fund rather than to local taxing bodies)].
Values:  'E' , 'T' or 'P' .

name: TAXDESC
title: Tax Status Description
description: Description for Tax Status codes:  '10 - Exempt', '20 - Taxable' or '12 - Public Utility Realty Tax - PURTA'.

name: TAXSUBCODE
title: Tax Sub Code
description: Tax Sub Code applies only to parcels having the PURTA tax status.  Public Utilities may not have to pay taxes (E-Exempt) or they may have to pay taxes into a state fund (T-Taxable).

name: TAXSUBCODE_DESC
title: Tax Sub Code Description
description: Values:  E - 'PURTA - Exempt',  T - 'PURTA -Taxable' or null.

name: OWNERCODE
title: Owner Type Code 1
description: Numeric code categorizes owner as individuals ('REGULAR' ) vs corporations ('CORPORATION').

name: OWNERDESC
title: Owner Description
description: Descriptions for numeric owner codes.  [e.g. individuals ('REGULAR' ) vs corporations ('CORPORATION')]

name: CLASS
title: Class
description:
Broad self-explanatory categories for describing the  general use of a parcel.
Categories:  R - RESIDENTIAL, U - UTILITIES, I - INDUSTRIAL, 
C - COMMERCIAL, O - OTHER, G - GOVERNMENT, F - AGRICULTURAL.

name: CLASSDESC
title: Class Description
description:
Broad self-explanatory categories for describing the  general use of a parcel.
Categories:  R - RESIDENTIAL, U - UTILITIES, I - INDUSTRIAL, 
C - COMMERCIAL, O - OTHER, G - GOVERNMENT, F - AGRICULTURAL.

name: USECODE
title: Land Use Code
description: More detailed than class, these categories further describe the primary use of the parcel.  There are about 200 self-explanatory categories.

name: USEDESC
title: Land Use Code Description
description: More detailed than class, these categories further describe the primary use of the parcel.  There are about 200 self-explanatory categories.

name: LOTAREA
title: Sum of Area of Land
description: Total square footage of land.

name: HOMESTEADFLAG
title: Homestead Flag
description: A property owner may apply for a homestead reduction on their primary residence.  If granted (indicated by 'HOM') the owner will receive a standard reduction on their assessment for County taxes under Act 50.  They may also receive a variable reduction on their School taxes under Act 1.

name: CLEANGREEN
title: Clean and Green Flag
description: This field indicates that a parcel is receiving a reduction in their assessment due to the state�s Clean and Green preferential assessment program.

name: FARMSTEADFLAG
title: Farmstead Flag
description: A property owner may apply for a farmstead reduction if their primary residence is a farm with at least 10 contiguous acres.  If granted (indicated by 'FRM') the owner will receive a standard reduction on their assessment for County taxes under Act 50.

name: ABATEMENTFLAG
title: Abatement Flag
description:
This field indicates that a parcel is receiving a reduction in their County assessment due to a County-approved incentive program.   Specific programs and amounts vary according to the County resolutions and ordinances in effect at the time.  Consult the Office of Property Assessments web page to see the current types of Abatements.

Abatements have been available to residential property owners as incentives for new construction and for building improvements.  Abatements for commercial properties have been available for local economic revitalization programs.

Values:  'Y' or null.

name: RECORDDATE
title: Record Date
description:
Date the sale was recorded 
in the Department of Real Estate (mm/dd/yyyy).

name: SALEDATE
title: Sale Date
description: Date the sale occurred  (mm/dd/yyyy).

name: SALEPRICE
title: Sale Price
description:
Amount paid for the sale 
(also called the consideration).

name: SALECODE
title: Sale Validity Code
description: A subjective categorization (code) as to whether or not the sale price was representative of current market value. These categorizations are subject to change as sales are reviewed by the Office of Property Assessments or during a reassessment. See further details in the Sale Validation Codes Details tab of the "Property Sale Transaction Data Dictionary".

name: SALEDESC
title: Sale Validity Code Description
description: A subjective categorization (description) as to whether or not the sale price was representative of current market value. These categorizations are subject to change as sales are reviewed by the Office of Property Assessments or during a reassessment. See further details in the Sale Validation Codes Details tab of the "Property Sale Transaction Data Dictionary".

name: DEEDBOOK
title: Book Number
description:
Cross-reference to the physical book number 
where the deed is on file
in the Department of Real Estate.

name: DEEDPAGE
title: Page Number
description:
Page within the specified deed book 
corresponding to the first page of 
this physical deed.

name: PREVSALEDATE
title: Previous Sale Date
description: Date the previous sale occurred  (mm/dd/yyyy).

name: PREVSALEPRICE
title: Previous Sale Price
description: Amount paid for the previous sale.

name: PREVSALEDATE2
title: Previous Sale Date 2
description: Date the 2nd previous sale occurred  (mm/dd/yyyy).

name: PREVSALEPRICE2
title: Previous Sale Price 2
description: Amount paid for the 2nd previous sale.

name: CHANGENOTICEADDRESS1
title: Change Notice Full Address 1
description: Address of owner of the property.

name: CHANGENOTICEADDRESS2
title: Change Notice Full Address 2
description: Address of owner of the property.

name: CHANGENOTICEADDRESS3
title: Change Notice Full Address 3
description: Address of owner of the property.

name: CHANGENOTICEADDRESS4
title: Change Notice Full Address 4
description: Address of owner of the property.

name: COUNTYBUILDING
title: County Assessed Value for Building
description: The assessed property value of the building for county tax purposes.   This amount reflects the remaining assessment after any preferential assessments (such as clean & green) or county reductions (such as homesteads or other abatements) have been deducted from the base year market values.

name: COUNTYLAND
title: County Assessed Value for Land
description: The assessed property value of the land for county tax purposes.   This amount reflects the remaining assessment after any preferential assessments (such as clean & green) or county reductions (such as homesteads or other abatements) have been deducted from the base year market values.

name: COUNTYTOTAL
title: County Assessed Value Total
description: The assessed property value (land and building together) for county tax purposes.   This amount reflects the remaining assessment after any preferential assessments (such as clean & green) or county reductions (such as homesteads or other abatements) have been deducted from the base year market values.

name: COUNTYEXEMPTBLDG
title: County Exempt Building Amount
description: The amount of assessment reduction granted on a building by the County (for county taxes only) under incentive programs for new construction, building improvements or local economic revitalization.

name: LOCALBUILDING
title: Local  Assessed Value for Building
description: The assessed property value of the building for local tax purposes (for schools and municipalities).   This amount reflects the remaining assessment after preferential assessments (such as clean & green) have been deducted from the base year market values.   This value is often higher than the county assessed value since county-only incentives (such as homesteads) have not been deducted.

name: LOCALLAND
title: Local Assessed Value for Land
description: The assessed property value of the land for local tax purposes (for schools and municipalities).   This amount reflects the remaining assessment after preferential assessments (such as clean & green) have been deducted from the base year market values.   This value is often higher than the county assessed value since county-only incentives (such as homesteads) have not been deducted.

name: LOCALTOTAL
title: Local Assessed Value Total
description: The assessed property value (land and building together) for local tax purposes (for schools and municipalities).   This amount reflects the remaining assessment after preferential assessments (such as clean & green) have been deducted from the base year market values.   This value is often higher than the county assessed value since county-only incentives (such as homesteads) have not been deducted.

name: FAIRMARKETBUILDING
title: Fair Market Building Value
description: The base year appraised fair market value of the building.  This value has had no reductions, not even Clean and Green preferential assessment reduction.  Allegheny County currently uses a base year of 2012.

name: FAIRMARKETLAND
title: Fair Market Land Value
description: The base year appraised fair market value of the land.  This value has had no reductions, not even Clean and Green preferential assessment reduction.  Allegheny County currently uses a base year of 2012.

name: FAIRMARKETTOTAL
title: Fair Market Total Value
description: The base year appraised fair market value of land and building together.  This value has had no reductions, not even Clean and Green preferential assessment reduction.  Allegheny County currently uses a base year of 2012.

name: STYLE
title: Architectural Style
description: The building style.

name: STYLEDESC
title: Architectural Style Description
description: Description for building style.

name: STORIES
title: Number of Stories
description: Refers to the story height of the main dwelling.  Attics are not included.  A fractional story height (e.g. 1.5) denotes an upper story where part of the living space is less than full height due to a sloped roof or dormers.

name: YEARBLT
title: Year Built
description: The original date of construction.

name: EXTERIORFINISH
title: Exterior Wall code
description: The exterior wall type.

name: EXTFINISH_DESC
title: Exterior Wall Description
description: Description of building material used for exterior walls.

name: ROOF
title: Roof
description: The roofing material type.

name: ROOFDESC
title: Roof Description
description: Description of roofing material.

name: BASEMENT
title: Basement
description:
This code describes the basement under the main part of the dwelling, and categorizes its size in relation to the main dwelling. 
1. NONE  - there is no basement.
2. SLAB/PIERS -indicates slab or pier construction.
3. CRAWL - indicates crawl space to 1/4 basement area.
4. PART - indicates basement is between 1/4 and 3/4 of the main dwelling area.
5. FULL - indicates 3/4 to full basement area.

name: BASEMENTDESC
title: Basement Description
description: Description of basement type, if one exists.

name: GRADE
title: Grade
description:
Grade refers to quality of construction:

A, X, XX  - have superior materials and workmanship and are typically custom designed or historic homes.
B - construction has above average construction and may exceed code.
C - is the standard, construction meets code, and is typical of current materials and methods.
D - construction is adequate, but below average with minimal features.
E - construction lacks some basics and may be a "camp" or seasonal structure.

Pluses and minuses may be used.

name: GRADEDESC
title: Grade Description
description:
Grade refers to quality of construction:

A, X, XX  - Very Good and Excellent - have superior materials and workmanship and are typically custom designed or historic homes.
B - Good - construction has above average construction and may exceed code.
C - Average - is the standard, construction meets code, and is typical of current materials and methods.
D - Below Average - construction is adequate, but below average with minimal features.
E - Poor - construction lacks some basics and may be a "camp" or seasonal structure.

Pluses and minuses may be used.

name: CONDITION
title: Condition
description:
Code for the overall physical condition or state of repair of a structure, relative to its age. Indicated by number and description:

1- Excellent - outstanding maintenance.
7- Very good - high degree of upkeep.
2- Good - above ordinary maintenance.
3- Average - ordinary maintenance, shows normal wear and tear.
4- Fair - sound but with noticeable deferred maintenance.
5- Poor - structural deterioration caused by significant and chronic deferred maintenance.
8- Very poor - barely livable.
6- Unsound - not suitable for habitation.

name: CONDITIONDESC
title: Condition Description
description:
Description for the overall physical condition or state of repair of a structure, relative to its age. Indicated by number and description:

1- Excellent - outstanding maintenance.
7- Very good - high degree of upkeep.
2- Good - above ordinary maintenance.
3- Average - ordinary maintenance, shows normal wear and tear.
4- Fair - sound but with noticeable deferred maintenance.
5- Poor - structural deterioration caused by significant and chronic deferred maintenance.
8- Very poor - barely livable.
6- Unsound - not suitable for habitation.

name: CDU
title: CDU
description:
CDU is a composite rating for structures measuring: 
Condition (physical condition relative to age), 
Desirability (location, style), and 
Utility (functional obsolescence of layout or design).  
Proper neighborhood delineation compensates for most Desirability and Utility issues, leaving Physical Condition the most influential factor in CDU.  CDU will be null for vacant land.
 
Excellent - Perfect condition, very attractive and highly desirable.
Very good - Slight deterioration, but still quite attractive and desirable.
Good - Minor visible deterioration, slightly less attractive and desirable, but still useful.
Average - Normal wear and tear, average utility and desirability.
Fair - Usable but marked deterioration.  Somewhat unattractive and undesirable.
Poor - Obvious deterioration, definitely undesirable.
Very poor - Extremely undesirable and barely usable.
Unsound - Unfit for use.

name: CDUDESC
title: CDU Description
description:
CDU is a composite rating for structures measuring: 
Condition (physical condition relative to age), 
Desirability (location, style), and 
Utility (functional obsolescence of layout or design).  
Proper neighborhood delineation compensates for most Desirability and Utility issues, leaving Physical Condition the most influential factor in CDU.  CDU will be null for vacant land.
 
Excellent - Perfect condition, very attractive and highly desirable.
Very good - Slight deterioration, but still quite attractive and desirable.
Good - Minor visible deterioration, slightly less attractive and desirable, but still useful.
Average - Normal wear and tear, average utility and desirability.
Fair - Usable but marked deterioration.  Somewhat unattractive and undesirable.
Poor - Obvious deterioration, definitely undesirable.
Very poor - Extremely undesirable and barely usable.
Unsound - Unfit for use.

name: TOTALROOMS
title: Total Rooms
description: Total number of rooms in the main dwelling.� This includes Rec-rooms and FBLA (Finished Basement Living Area).� This count is for descriptive purposes only and does not affect assessed value.

name: BEDROOMS
title: Bedrooms
description: The total number of separate rooms designed to be used as bedrooms.  If a room was designed to be a bedroom, but is being utilized for some other purpose - such as a den, it is to be included in this count.  This is for descriptive purposes only and does not affect value.

name: FULLBATHS
title: Full Baths
description: A full bath has a toilet, sink and bathing facility (shower or tub).

name: HALFBATHS
title: Half Baths
description: A half bath has a toilet and sink only.

name: HEATINGCOOLING
title: Heating Cooling
description: Code for the type of Heating / Cooling system.

name: HEATINGCOOLINGDESC
title: Heating Cooling Description
description: Description for the type Heating / Cooling system.

name: FIREPLACES
title: Number of Wood burning Fireplaces Stacks
description: The number of wood-burning fireplace chimneys/vents.  This need not equal the number of working fireplaces in the dwelling.  This number excludes roof stacks built for bathroom venting, natural gas outlets, etc.

name: BSMTGARAGE
title: Integral Basement Garage (Number of Cars)
description: The number of vehicle spaces available in a garage that is basement level and comprises a portion of the main dwelling�s basement.� This does not include detached or attached above-grade garages.

name: FINISHEDLIVINGAREA
title: Total Square Feet of Living Area
description: Finished living area, as measured from the outside of the structure.

name: CARDNUMBER
title: Building (card) Number
description: For parcels having more than one building only one building is shown. This field contains the number of the building being shown (which is usually the main dwelling).

name: ALT_ID
title: Alternate Parcel Identification Number
description: In tax year 2007, parcel ID numbers within certain municipalities were converted to conform to  Allegheny County's standard naming convention for parcel ID's.   For affected parcels, this field shows the old parcel ID that was in use for tax years 2006 and prior.

name: TAXYEAR
title: The current certified tax year
description:
The  applicable year for which real estate taxes would apply for the parcel.  Allegheny County currently assesses value based on how the parcel stood as of Jan 1 of that year.   

This need not correspond to a calendar year.

name: ASOFDATE
title: The run date of this file
description: The run date of this file.
